content.description: This bouldery route starts under the T-Roof left of T-Roofic. Boulder up left and then back a little right to the chains. Holds may have broken, choss?
content.location: left of T-Roofic Detour under the roof

content.description: This is a slightly harder/longer variation on T-Roofic Detour.  Both are fun, overhung, jug-hauls which test your endurance more than your technique.  You'll want a stick clip for the Direct variation.
content.location: Start under the second bolt of T-Roofic Detour and avoid scampering up the slabby ramp as you would for T-Roofic Detour.

content.description: One of the best 5.10s at Reimer's.  Start on a tufa with good holds and climb to a ledge and the first bolt.  Step right onto the main face, and then continue up and right to the second bolt.  Head straight up from the second bolt and climb through the rocky overhangs.  There are a couple of sketchy moves just below the anchor, but they are not bad.  T-Roofic is a well bolted route - each clip protects a tough move.  You don't really realize how much the route overhangs until you rap.  Fun route, not to be missed.
content.protection: Five bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Climbs up the right side of the large roof in the center of the T-Roofic Wall.

content.description: Start on a ledge and head right under a roof. It stays overhanging through the end, though it may not appear so from the ground.
content.location: The ledge on the let end of T-Roofic Wall

content.description: Starts left of vertical stain in the dihedral. Left of "Fearless". Climbs up through three bolts then converges back onto Fearless' anchors. Tough sharp pockets with some tricky footwork and a good pump up through the third bolt.
content.location: Rightmost side of T-Roofic area. 2nd route from the right.

content.description: Start climb as for T-Roofic Detour. At bolt 3, traverse right to Flea Circus bolt 3. Finish on Flea Circus.
content.location: Same start as T-Roofic, finish on anchors of Flea Circus.

content.description: Pull the first roof on Flea Circus and then traverse left along the lip to T-Roofic’s 2nd bolt and finish T-Roofic. Fun and a little scary. Uses the first two bolts of Flea Circus and then bolt 2 of T-roofic and finish T-roofic.
content.location: Start Flea Circus and traverse into T-Roofic.

content.description: Start to the right of T-Roofic Detour (and T-Roofic Direct) off the right side of the ramp and under the low roof. Make your way to the drilled 4-finger slot, and pull the roof. Get to a short rest then execute a tricky little finish to the anchors.
content.location: Center of T-Roofic Wall, the next route to the right of T-Roofic.

content.description: The start of Fearless is a little slick.  The first bolt can be clipped from the ground, and there is ground fall potential at the second bolt.  The crux is a mantle on a ledge just below the second bolt.  The final moves to the chains are also a little thin and committing.
content.protection: Three bolts to two bolt anchor shared with Grip Clip (5.12a).
content.location: First climb on the right side of the T-Roofic Wall, immediately left of a tree (climbs a dihedral).

content.description: The T-Roofic Wall is a unique area at Reimer's Ranch.  The orange colored rock split by a number of large roofs is hard to miss.  The climbs are mostly a little longer (4-6 bolts) and are all within the 5.10 to 5.12 range.  T-Roofic Detour is one of the best routes here and not to be missed.
